question_text: A company runs an application on AWS. The application receives inconsistent amounts of usage. The application uses AWS Direct Connect to connect to an on-premises MySQL-compatible database. The on-premises database consistently uses a minimum of 2 GiB of memory. The company wants to migrate the on-premises database to a managed AWS service. The company wants to use auto scaling capabilities to manage unexpected workload increases. Which solution will meet these requirements with the LEAST administrative overhead?

options.A: Provision an Amazon DynamoDB database with default read and write capacity settings.
options.B: Provision an Amazon Aurora database with a minimum capacity of 1 Aurora capacity unit (ACU).
options.C: Provision an Amazon Aurora Serverless v2 database with a minimum capacity of 1 Aurora capacity unit (ACU).
options.D: Provision an Amazon RDS for MySQL database with 2 GiB of memory.
